intro: Psychotria tetraphylla, commonly known as the four-leaf psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Psychotria tetraphylla is also known for its association with certain species of epiphytic plants and its role in local ecosystems.
